entry.et: Middle English deel, from Old English dǣl; akin to Old English dāl division, portion, Old High German teil part

def.dt: :part portion
:a usually large or indefinite quantity or degree a great deal of support a good deal faster
:the act or right of distributing cards to players in a card game
:hand 9b
:to give as one's portion :apportion tried to deal justice to all dealt out three sandwiches apiece
:to distribute (playing cards) to players in a game
:administer deliver dealt him a blow
:sell deals drugs
:trade deal a player to another team
:to distribute the cards in a card game
:to concern oneself or itself the book deals with education
:to engage in bargaining :trade
:to sell or distribute something as a business deal in insurance
:to take action with regard to someone or something deal with an offender
:to reach or try to reach a state of acceptance or reconcilement trying to deal with her son's death
:an act of dealing :transaction
:bargain
:contract 1a signed a 2-year deal
:package deal
:treatment received a dirty deal
:an arrangement for mutual advantage
:affair 2 dinner was an informal deal
:situation story what is the deal with that guy?
:mccoy used in the phrase the real deal

entry.et: Middle English dele, from Middle Dutch or Middle Low German, plank; akin to Old High German dili plank thill

def.dt: :a board of fir or pine
:pine or fir wood
:something of special importance what's the big deal? sometimes used ironically as an interjection
:fait accompli thought the trade was a done deal
:a considerable quantity or extent :lot knows a good deal about disease a good deal faster

entry.et: from the supposed resemblance to the situation of freshness and equality of opportunity afforded by a fresh deal in a card game

def.dt: :the legislative and administrative program of President F. D. Roosevelt designed to promote economic recovery and social reform during the 1930s
:the period of this program
:an offer or agreement involving a number of related items or one making acceptance of one item dependent on the acceptance of another
:the items offered in a package deal
:an instance of unfair treatment
